{{Copy edit|for = grammar, style, cohesion, tone, or spelling |date = February 2011}} {{Infobox sports season | title =2009â10 Nemzeti BajnoksÃ¡g I | league =[[Nemzeti BajnoksÃ¡g I (Women's handball)|Nemzeti BajnoksÃ¡g I]] | sport =[[Team handball]] | duration = 2 September 2009 â 15 May 2010 | season =Regular season | season_champ =[[GyÅri Audi ETO KC]] | top_scorer ={{flagicon|HUN}} [[TÃ­mea TÃ³th]] (225) | playoffs =Playoffs | playoffs_link = | conf1 =NB I | conf1_link = | conf1_champ =[[GyÅri Audi ETO KC]] | conf1_runner-up =[[DVSC (Women's handball)|DVSC-Korvex]] | seasonslist = | seasonslistnames =Nemzeti BajnoksÃ¡g I | prevseason_link =2008â09 Nemzeti BajnoksÃ¡g I (Women's handball) | prevseason_year =2008â09 | nextseason_link =2010â11 Nemzeti BajnoksÃ¡g I (Women's handball) | nextseason_year =2010â11 }} The '''2009â10 Nemzeti BajnoksÃ¡g I''' was the fifty-ninth edition of the top level championship in the [[Hungary|Hungarian]] [[team handball]] for women. [[GyÅri Audi ETO KC]] were the defending champions and they retained the championship by going undefeated throughout the season. The competition began on September 2, with the regular season ending on March 27. The playoffs ended on May 15, with [[VÃ¡ci NKSE]] beating [[BÃ©kÃ©scsabai ElÅre NKSE|Mondi BÃ©kÃ©scsabai ENKSE]] thus taking the bronze medal. ==Overview== ===Teams=== {{location map+ |Hungary |float=right |width=600 |caption=Locations of the 2009â10 Nemzeti BajnoksÃ¡g I teams |places= {{location map~ |Hungary |lat=47.18877 |long=18.41384 |label=

[[VeszprÃ©m BarabÃ¡s KC]]
|position=left||mark=Arrows 12x12 e.svg}} }} [[Vasas SC (Women's handball)|Vasas SC]] and [[PTE-PEAC (Women's handball)|PTE-PEAC]] were relegated to the 2009â10 [[Nemzeti BajnoksÃ¡g I/B (Women's handball)|Nemzeti BajnoksÃ¡g I/B]] after finishing the 2008â09 season in the bottom two places. 1982 European Champions Cup winners Vasas SC ended a fouty-two years spell in the top division, having been played in the Nemzeti BajnoksÃ¡g I since 1967. Newcomers PTE-PEAC, the handball team of the [[University of PÃ©cs]], did not have too much time to taste the real handball and suffered relegation just after one season. Despite ranked seventh in the last year's championship, [[NyÃ­radony KK (Women's handball)|Tajtavill-NyÃ­radony]] had to pull out from the competition as well, after they lost many of their sponsors and faced a serious financial trouble. Finally, team president Tajta JÃ¡nos, who spent about one million euro on the team during his five year ownership, have announced on 8 July 2010 that the club was ceased and withdrew from all competitions.{{cite news|url=http://handball.hu/2009/07/08/megszunt_a_nyiradonyi_csapat/|title=MegszÅ±nt a nyÃ­radonyi csapat|publisher=Handball.hu|date=8 July 2010|accessdate=19 February 2011l|language=Hungarian}} The three teams were replaced by [[Hunnia KSK]], [[VeszprÃ©m BarabÃ¡s KC]] and [[SiÃ³fok KC]]. The league comprised two teams from Budapest (FerencvÃ¡rosi TC, Hunnia KSK); three clubs from Central Transdanubia (Alcoa FehÃ©rvÃ¡r KC, DunaÃºjvÃ¡rosi NKKSE and VeszprÃ©m BarabÃ¡s KC); three teams from the Southern Great Plain (ASA-Consolis HÃ³dmezÅvÃ¡sÃ¡rely, Kiskunhalas NKSE-Bravotel and Mondi BÃ©kÃ©scsabai ENKSE); and one each from Western Transdanubia (GyÅri Audi ETO KC), Southern Transdanubia (SiÃ³fok KC), Central Hungary (VÃ¡ci NKSE) and the Northern Great Plain (DVSC-Korvex). The sides played twice against each other in the regular season on a home and on an away leg. Top four teams qualified for the playoffs, where a best-of-three system was used. Teams ranked fifth to ninth and tenth to twelfth decided their final rank in a classification round, using a round robin system, playing six additional rounds. They were also awarded bonus points according their final position in the regular season. League champions and runners-up enter the [[2010â11 EHF Women's Champions League|2010â2011 EHF Champions League]], while the top two teams following them have the right to take part in the [[2010â11 Women's EHF Cup|2010â11 EHF Cup]]. [[SABMiller]] bought the naming rights and changed its name to promote the Arany Ãszok beer. The playoffs started on 10 April 2010 and ran until 15 May 2010. ===Classification round 9â12=== Bottom four teams after the regular season entered a classification round in which they tried to avoid the relegation. The sides faced each other in a double round robin system and were given additional points according to their final position in the regular season. Ninth placed VeszprÃ©m BarabÃ¡s KC got four points, tenth placed HÃ³dmezÅvÃ¡sÃ¡rhely were awarded three, Kiskunhalas took two points and even last placed Hunnia KSK were given one point.
